familyCars.name: Dacia Jogger
familyCars.description: The Jogger really sits in a class of its own, thanks to its bargain price tag, especially in the entry-level Essential petrol form...

familyCars.name: Skoda Superb Estate
familyCars.description: While the Skoda Superb hatch is good, we highly rate the Estate model, thanks to its 660-litre boot. It’s supremely refined on the move, due to its soft suspension...

familyCars.name: Peugeot 408
familyCars.description: Regardless, there’s much more to the 408 than its bold styling. The single non-hybrid turbocharged petrol engine is our pick of the range...

familyCars.name: BMW 3 Series
familyCars.description: The BMW 3 Series has been one of the best cars you can buy for decades. The current G20 generation is longer and wider than the previous version, but it’s up to 55kg lighter, has a 25 per cent stiffer body, and drives even more sweetly no matter which powertrain you choose...

familyCars.name: Nissan Qashqai
familyCars.description: The Nissan Qashqai is credited as being the car that really kicked off the SUV boom. It wasn’t really the first, but its mixture of car-like handling, practicality, build quality and pricing hit a sweet spot when it launched in 2007...

familyCars.name: Hyundai Kona
familyCars.description: The original Hyundai Kona was a very sensible small SUV, but it lacked the rear cabin space or luggage capacity to take on the best family cars on the market. That’s all changed with the all-new second-generation Kona...

familyCars.name: Hyundai Tucson
familyCars.description: With the fourth-generation Tucson, Hyundai set its sights on some of the more premium offerings in the hugely competitive mid-size SUV market. Striking and distinctive looks, plenty of standard equipment across the range and an overall sense of top build quality are just some of the features that have earned the Tucson the title of Mid-size SUV of the Year at our New Car Awards for three years in a row...

familyCars.name: Honda Civic
familyCars.description: Like the Toyota Corolla, the 11th-generation Honda Civic is available exclusively with a self-charging hybrid powertrain. It’s smooth, efficient and capable of returning over 50mpg without breaking a sweat...

familyCars.name: Toyota Corolla Touring Sports
familyCars.description: The Toyota Corolla Touring Sports recently received a facelift that included the usual styling tweaks, but more importantly, upgrades to its hybrid system and a new infotainment setup that make this practical family wagon better than ever...

familyCars.name: Skoda Octavia
familyCars.description: The Skoda Octavia is a brilliant all-rounder that delivers on the essentials: competitive pricing, plenty of space and practicality, useful on-board tech and a range of efficient petrol and diesel engines...

familyCars.name: Volkswagen Tiguan
familyCars.description: The Volkswagen Tiguan offers a versatile interior, advanced safety features, and a spacious cabin. With its stylish design and a range of available options, it caters to the needs of families and adventure enthusiasts alike...

featuredCars.description: The Bentayga doesn't shout; you could hear it cutting through the air. The 6.0L W12 engine is super stunning and super powerful. An air suspension system, four-zone climate controls, Traction control, rear-mounted spoiler, and a Mulliner Driving specification that gives a lot of extras to offer.
featuredCars.caption: Experience luxury and power with the Bentley Bentayga 6.0L W12. A masterpiece of engineering and design.

featuredCars.description: The Blackhawk, also called the Laredo, came into the market and took it by storm. It comes equipped with a 3.6-liter engine and various off-road modes. The Jeep Grand Cherokee combines practicality and class, making it a versatile choice for any adventure.
featuredCars.caption: Discover the Jeep Grand Cherokee, a perfect blend of practicality and class. Ready for any off-road adventure.

featuredCars.description: In early 2017, BMW introduced a new limited edition called the BLACKOUT EDITION, featuring a range of All-Black X3, X4, and X5s, exclusively for BMW Japan. Only 310 units were produced, and this unit is listed as number 187 of 310. The BMW X4 XDrive 28i features a different fascia, a 2.0L N20B20 inline-4 turbocharged petrol engine, leather seats with memory and heating function, rear armrest, heads-up display, and a sunroof.
featuredCars.caption: Experience luxury in the limited edition BMW X4 XDrive 28i BLACKOUT EDITION. Only 310 units were produced, and this is number 187. A unique blend of style and performance.

featuredCars.description: The Range Rover Sport HSE, sitting above SE trim and just below the top-spec 5.0L V8 Supercharged, offers high standard equipment. Features include a standard air suspension system for improved comfort and stability at high speeds and when engaging corners, an All-Wheel Drive system with terrain response management system and multiple offroad modes, and an eight-speed automatic transmission gearbox. The infotainment system is upgraded with a 10-inch Touchscreen for convenient car specs access, and safety features include an automatic emergency braking system, lane-keep assist, and a blind-spot warning system.
featuredCars.caption: Discover the Range Rover Sport 3.0 SDV6 HSE, a blend of luxury and high-performance. Equipped with advanced features for a superior driving experience.

featuredCars.description: The Volkswagen Tiguan has been the best-selling SUV in the Volkswagen Group, with over 900,000 units produced in 2019 alone. It is an excellent compact crossover, offering the best efficiency with its 1.4L TSI engine rated at 148hp, consuming close to what a Mazda Demio does.
featuredCars.caption: Explore the efficiency and popularity of the Volkswagen Tiguan 1.4TSI. The best-selling SUV with impressive features and performance.
